Key Match Events: Monk had 26 points, 12 assists, 4 steals, 3 rebounds, and 1 incredible soaring block.
The Kings shot 44.2% from 3 on 43 attempts.
Devin Carter finished this one with 13 points, 7 rebounds, 2 assists, and a steal.
Doug Christie was on the floor and looked ready to fight Steve Kerr.
The Kings won 4 straight games and are playing with a fire they did not have before.
Post-Match Reflections: Doug Christie was ready for a fight and was restrained by Domas.
The Kings' defense was active and rotated well, with even the bench players playing excellent defense in garbage time.
The team is playing better than at any point all season, but it's unclear if this is a honeymoon period or if the team will sustain this level of play.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings' offense has been impressive, with an average of 30 assists over the last 5 games.
The team is getting the best possible shot, similar to the Celtics.
The 3pt defense has been better, with teams shooting under 40% from 3 over the last 5 games.
The Kings will face tough matchups against the best of the East and some tough West matchups.
Devin Carter is a promising young player who is already making an impact.
The team's ball movement has been consistently impressive.
Others: The Kings host the Miami Heat on Monday, January 6th at 7 PM PT.
The Kings' defense has been a major factor in their recent success.
The team's offense has been impressive, but it's unclear if they can sustain this level of play.
